#Text=CanadaVOTES : NDP candidate Paul Arbour in Carleton — Mississippi Mills
#Text=Friday , October 10 , 2008
#Text=In an attempt to speak with as many candidates as possible during the 2008 Canadian federal election , Wikinews has talked via email with Paul Arbour .
#Text=Arbour is a candidate in Ontario 's Carleton — Mississippi Mills riding , running under the New Democratic Party ( NDP ) banner .
#Text=The riding is currently represented by Gordon O'Connor , a Conservative .
#Text=The Minister of National Revenue , O'Connor is up against the NDP 's Arbour , Liberal Justin Mackinnon , and Green Jake Cole .
#Text=Previous MPs in the riding were Progressive Conservative , Liberal , and Canadian Alliance members .
#Text=A riding since 1988 , Carleton — Mississippi Mills is in the Capital region .
#Text=The following is an interview with Arbour , conducted via email .
#Text=The interview has had very limited editing , to eliminate in-text mentions of website addresses , but is otherwise left exactly as sent to Wikinews .
#Text=Interview
#Text=Why are you running for political office , why at the federal level , why this party , and why in this riding ?
#Text=I am running for federal office because I feel that is where I have the most to offer , and where the issues that affect myself and my friends are the most significant .
#Text=I have chosen to run for the NDP because not only is this a party of strong leadership , but also because I really believe in the messages of the party .
#Text=I am running in this riding because it is where I live and play .
#Text=Previous to this campaign , have you been politically involved ?
#Text=How will you apply your previous work/volunteer/life experience to serving your constituents ?
#Text=I have been politically active almost my entire life .

#Text=As a student I was strongly involved in FESFO(The Francophone Students Federation ) , and when I moved to this area I became involved in the party as a member of the riding association executive .
#Text=I have been working through the ' tech burst ' and know very well how it has affect the people of this riding and this country .
#Text=I also have a great deal of experience driving for what is right .
#Text=I have been referred to in my job as a ' pitbull ' because I do n't give up on a problem or issue just because someone says that there is no easy solution .
#Text=Usually the most difficult solutions are also the most effective .
#Text=As a member of Toastmasters I have learned an incredible amount about speaking , sharing information , working as part of a team , and providing strong leadership to my peers .
#Text=Through my work as a Stage Manager for musical theater I have learned to wear many hats at the same time , build teams , friendships , and strengthen groups to achieve very complex goals
#Text=As you campaign around your riding , it 's likely that some issues are mentioned more often by voters , than other issues .
#Text=What would you say are the three hottest topics this election , in your riding ?
#Text=What would you and your party do to address these issues ?
#Text=The biggest issue around this riding and across the country is the economy .

#Text=We see the ' economy ' as a blanket statement , but at the end of the day , for myself anyway , I see the ' economy ' as being a question of whether or not I will have a job tomorrow . : For so many people , knowledge workers and others alike , knowing that one might be out of work tomorrow causes an incredible amount of stress on individuals and their families .

#Text=The NDP has a strong plan to address the loss of jobs in this country , and I personally have a plan to move our technology sector forward by working with industry leaders , and community members .
#Text=Training and skills advancement is the only way that we as Canadians will be able to distinguish ourselves in the future knowledge economy .
#Text=Are there any misconceptions about you , your leader , or your party and platform ?
#Text=I do n't know about any misconceptions about myself , but many people believe that the NDP does n't have the drive or skill to run this country .
#Text=That is absolutely false .
#Text=We have the depth of experience and passion to move this country forward .
#Text=There are more ways than ever to get your message out , from the traditional campaign fliers and lawn signs , to new media like websites , Facebook , and YouTube .
#Text=The tried-and-true routes get the message out to the masses much easier , but digital alternatives are much more measurable in how many are seeing or interacting with your campaign .
#Text=What seems to be the most effective , from your experience ?
#Text=So far I 've been trying just about everything , it would seem that web pages are currently the way to go .
#Text=I have received many comments , questions , and kudos by people because they have seen the web page and know where to find us .

#Text=I have received many complaints this election about the number of signs throughout the community and that brings me forward to question where exactly this will lead in the future I do n't know .
#Text=Doing away with campaign signs sounds like a good idea to me since they seem to be so wasteful .
#Text=In this campaign we are experimenting with different marketing techniques that go along with ' fliers ' but line up more toward a marketing campaign .
#Text=Since we have the ability and technology do do small run , high quality documents from the home , why not put those to use , and tailor the message to the audience .
